title: M&S Foodhall plans delayed by Tesco opposition - Retail Gazette
summary:
- M&S Foodhall expansion plans for six locations are facing delays due to objections from Tesco, which has requested judicial reviews for two specific sites.
- The judicial review for an M&S Foodhall in Hatfield is pending, while another in Blackburn has encountered multiple judicial reviews and local council opposition.
- Tesco's objections are based on planning policy grounds, asserting that the M&S stores were approved without adhering to a "town centre first" approach.
- M&S is committed to expanding its food business, recently announcing a Â£340 million investment in a new food distribution center to support its growth strategy.
- Retail executives should monitor the implications of planning objections on store expansion and consider the competitive landscape when planning new locations.
